page.title: 03Kinbrace, Sutherland
page.content: Kinbrace came into being when a station was built there in 1874.In 1883 a school was built there because many pupils could travel by train to school. Since then there have been many comings and goings of people. Now there is only a shop, a post office, a garage, two churches and twelve houses. Not so long ago there were sheep sales at Kinbrace. All that is now left is the auctioneer's office which is the Kinbrace boys' hut. The shop at Kinbrace is really a miniature supermarket. It is not busy in winter but in summer it supplies the shooting lodges with groceries and wines. The post office is part of the shop. There is a garage and a village hall which was used for wedding anniversaries, parties and celebrations throughout the years. Today it is falling down.
